attributes.text:
Creates a Carousel widget. A carousel is a widget which can switch between several sub pages {@link qx.ui.mobile.container.Composite}. A page switch is triggered by a swipe to left, for next page, or a swipe to right for previous page.

A carousel shows by default a pagination indicator at the bottom of the carousel. This pagination indicator can be hidden by property showPagination.

Example

Here is a little example of how to use the widget.


 var carousel = new qx.ui.mobile.container.Carousel();
 var carouselPage1 = new qx.ui.mobile.container.Composite();
 var carouselPage2 = new qx.ui.mobile.container.Composite();

 carouselPage1.add(new qx.ui.mobile.basic.Label("This is a carousel. Please swipe left."));
 carouselPage2.add(new qx.ui.mobile.basic.Label("Now swipe right."));

 carousel.add(carouselPage1);
 carousel.add(carouselPage2);
transition duration on carouselPage change in seconds.
Called when showPagination property is changed. Manages show(), hide() of pagination container.
The page index to which the scroller should move to.
Manages the the scroll loop. First fades out carousel scroller >> waits till fading is done >> scrolls to pageIndex >> waits till scrolling is done >> fades scroller in.
Handles window resize, device orientatonChange or page appear events.
Handles a tap on paginationLabel.
The swipe event.
Handler for swipe on carousel scroller.
The touch event.
Event handler for touchmove events.
The touch event.
Event handler for touchstart events.
the target value of the opacity.
Changes the opacity of the carouselScroller element.
Target value which triggers transition.

Determines whether a transition should be shown on carouselScroller move or not. Target value will be buffered, and only be set on target element when target value is different to the value alreay set.

Snaps carouselScroller offset to a carouselPage. It determines which carouselPage is the nearest and moves carouselScrollers offset till nearest carouselPage’s left border is aligned to carousel’s left border.
Updates the layout of the carousel the carousel scroller and its pages.
Index of paginationLabel which should loose active state
Index of paginationLabel which should have active state
Updates the pagination indicator of this carousel. Removes the active state from from paginationLabel with oldActiveIndex, Adds actives state to paginationLabel new ActiveIndex.
scroller’s x position.
scroller’s y position.
Assign new position of carousel scrolling container.
The composite which should be added as a page to the end of carousel.
Adds a page to the end of the carousel.

Returns the (computed) value of the property height.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #height}.
(Computed) value of height.

Returns the (computed) value of the property scrollLoop.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollLoop}.
(Computed) value of scrollLoop.
Returns the current visible page index.
page index of the {@link qx.ui.mobile.container.Composite} which is shown.

Returns the (computed) value of the property showPagination.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #showPagination}.
(Computed) value of showPagination.
Initial value for property height.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property height with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #height}.
the default value
Initial value for property scrollLoop.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property scrollLoop with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollLoop}.
the default value
Initial value for property showPagination.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property showPagination with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #showPagination}.
the default value

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property scrollLoop equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollLoop}.
Whether the property equals true.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property showPagination equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #showPagination}.
Whether the property equals true.
Scrolls the carousel to next page.
Scrolls the carousel to previous page.
The page index which should be removed from carousel.
Removes a carousel page from carousel identified by its index.

Resets the user value of the property height.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #height}.

Resets the user value of the property scrollLoop.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollLoop}.

Resets the user value of the property showPagination.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #showPagination}.
the target page index, which should be visible
flag if a transition should be shown or not
Scrolls the carousel to the page with the given pageIndex.
New value for property height.

Sets the user value of the property height.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #height}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property scrollLoop.

Sets the user value of the property scrollLoop.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollLoop}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property showPagination.

Sets the user value of the property showPagination.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #showPagination}.
The unmodified incoming value.
Target value of swipeVelocityLimit. Typical within the range of [0.1-10]. Default value is 1.5

If velocity of swipe is above this value, the swipe will trigger a page change on carousel. A swipe to left would trigger an increase, a swipe to right a decrease of pageIndex. If velocity is below the limit, the snap mechanism of carousel will be used: A page change is only caused when the horizontal center of the page is moved above/below the horizontal center of the carousel.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property scrollLoop.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollLoop}.
the new value

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property showPagination.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #showPagination}.
the new value
Defines the height of the carousel.
Defines whether the carousel should scroll back to first or last page when the start/end of carousel pages is reached
Property for setting visibility of pagination indicator
